comments:
Build ID:  20070615-1148

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Open a library with missing object developped in EPF 1.02
2.Answer OK to the question "Do you want to proceed the upgrade" ? and select backup location ...
3.After few minutes a dialog box appear with IUPL0306E: Failed to upgrade the method library. Please see the log file for more details.

Remarks :
--------
1) It will be a major issue if we can not "clean" the library and upgrade the library as we will have to stick to 1.0.2.
2) Provide more help to fix corrupted library 

3)We use ClearCase & we are working in parallel on the library (5 people)


More information:
 * in log you have line like !ENTRY org.eclipse.epf.library.persistence 4 0 2007-06-26 16:56:44.371
!MESSAGE Could not find object with id '_nlQcIWpNEdu3BMcX0ToO-g'

The stack :
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal group reference
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.appendReplacement(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.MigrationUtil.validateGuidAttribute(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.MigrationUtil.validateGuidAttribute(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.MigrationUtil.formatValue(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.Migrator103.updateElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.Migrator103.updateElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.MigratorBase.updateAllContents(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.xmi.internal.migration.Migrator103.migrate(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.migration.MappingUtil.migrate(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.ui.LibraryUIManager$4.execute(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

If the 1.0.2 library is corrupted, migration can not be guaranteed to be successul.

If you could privode the library, we can help look what's the issues with the library.
This was a migration bug, and has been fixed. Please try the latest build.
Any build after June 21, 2007 should have the fix.
I tried with the latest nightly build epf-composer-1.2.0M4-N.20070627-1041-win32 and the migration succeed. Thank you for your help.
